Countries that use the Polish złoty

The Polish złoty was established in 1924 as an official national currency and is used only in Poland. It replaced the previously valid Polish marka. 1 Złoty is devided into 100 Groszy.

Currency reserves for the Polish złoty

According to the International Monetary Fund, the total broad money (M3) amounted to PLN 2.267 trillion at the end of 2023. For currency hedging, reserves were held in a total amount of 814.60 billion złotys. This corresponds to a ratio of 1:2.8. Or in other words, 10 of 28 złotys are deposited with a countervalue, which is internationally already above average.
